reviews.text: Trains to London seem to be delayed every time I depart from here. Wouldn't think this would happen given the extortionate prices that are charged. £114 a day to go to London and back in peak time. Much better off travelling to Northampton or Milton Keynes and departing from there.
Being that it's in a small town it's likely it's going to be a small station. It's well kept and I think one day the council when they can afford to do so look to giving it a modernisation
Nice Little Station, well layed out, good parking including free 15 minute parking.

Lost property found - staff going the extra mile.  Lost my rucksack on train to Derby one day ago and the staff were impressive.  Told one lady who was working in the evening and she not only took details but came in the next day to catch up with staff to ensure it was chased (unsure of name - sorry).  Then another member Karen liased with Derby station and ensured they located my item.  To someone who had a lot of important things in there work related and personal I was so relieved.  And all thanks to the brilliant staff at the station.  Thank you so much
Station in need of modernisation. Routes & schedules particularly to London Stations good. Ample parking. Good coffee shop. Staff are freindly and helpful.
